messages.subject: beautiful kozuka
messages.msgSnippet: found this beautiful kozuka while web surfing www.japanese-art.mcmail.com/Docu/kozuka.htm another bit of info on kozuka - and peek into Japanese mind set of
messages.messageBody:
found this beautiful kozuka while web surfing

www.japanese-art.mcmail.com/Docu/kozuka.htm

another bit of info on kozuka - and peek into Japanese mind set of
the day [at least late Edo period, anyway] -- representation of prime
minister as a pig.

also found translation [asserted anyway] of old meaning of kozuka as
both "knife" or "art piece".

to bad kogatanna was tossed. Any examples of complete daisho, in the
original mounts out there -- i would bet the kogatana made by same
smith [or student] who made the sword. complete set would be quite a
plum.

doug e.
